title: Trials testing new educational methods in schools 'often fail to produce useful evidence'

title_detail.value: Trials testing new educational methods in schools 'often fail to produce useful evidence'

summary: The new study found that 40% of large-scale randomized controlled trials (RCTs) in the UK and the US failed to produce any evidence as to whether an educational intervention helped to boost academic attainment or not.
